data.text:
Mary Anne Wisniowiecki1

F, #114571, d. 1624

Last Edited=2 Sep 2002

Mary Anne Wisniowiecki married James Sobieski in 1620.1 She died in 1624.1

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 131. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

Theoplie Danilowicz1

F, #114572, b. 1607, d. 1661

Last Edited=2 Sep 2002

Theoplie Danilowicz was born in 1607.1 She married James Sobieski in 1627.1 She died in 1661.1

Child of Theoplie Danilowicz and James Sobieski

John III Sobieski, King of Poland+1 b. 9 Jun 1624, d. 17 Jun 1696

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 131. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

Rafael Leszczynski1

M, #114573, b. 1650, d. 1703

Last Edited=5 Nov 2015

Rafael Leszczynski was born in 1650.1 He married Anne Jablonowska in 1676.1 He died in 1703.1

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 131. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

[S37] BP2003 volume 2, page 3082. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Anne Jablonowska1

F, #114574, b. 1660, d. 1727

Last Edited=5 Nov 2015

Anne Jablonowska was born in 1660.1 She married Rafael Leszczynski in 1676.1 She died in 1727.1

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 131. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

[S37] BP2003 volume 2, page 3082. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Salome von Berg1

F, #114575, d. 1144

Last Edited=30 May 2014

Children of Salome von Berg and Boleslaw III, Duke of Poland

Heinrich, Duke of Sandomir1 d. 1166

Richza of Poland+2 b. 12 Apr 1116, d. 16 Jun 1185

Boleslaw IV, Duke of Cracow b. 1125, d. 1173

Mieszko III, Duke of Poland+1 b. 1126, d. 1202

Dobronega of Poland+ b. c 1128, d. a 26 Oct 1147

Casimir II, Duke of Cracow+1 b. 1138, d. 1194

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 132. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

[S1916] Tim Boyle, "re: Boyle Family," e-mail message to Darryl Roger Lundy, 16 September 2006. Hereinafter cited as "re: Boyle Family."

Heinrich Graf von Berg-Schalklingen1

M, #114576

Last Edited=7 Feb 2004

Heinrich Graf von Berg-Schalklingen gained the title of Graf von Berg-Schalklingen.

Child of Heinrich Graf von Berg-Schalklingen

Salome von Berg+1 d. 1144

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 132. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

Wladislaw I Herman, Duke of Poland1

M, #114577, b. 1043, d. 1102

Last Edited=2 Jul 2022

Wladislaw I Herman, Duke of Poland was born in 1043.1 He was the son of Casimir I, Duke of Poland and Dobronega Maria of Kiev.1 He married, firstly, Judith of Bohemia, daughter of Vladislav I, Duke of Bohemia, circa 1080.1 He married, secondly, Judith Salian, daughter of Heinrich III, Holy Roman Emperor and Agnes de Poitou, circa 1089.1 He died in 1102.1

He succeeded as the Duke of Poland in 1080.1

Children of Wladislaw I Herman, Duke of Poland and Judith of Bohemia

Zbigniew, Duke of Poland2 d. 1107

Boleslaw III, Duke of Poland+1 b. 1085, d. 1138

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 132. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

[S38] John Morby, Dynasties of the World: a chronological and genealogical handbook (Oxford, Oxfordshire, U.K.: Oxford University Press, 1989), page 157. Hereinafter cited as Dynasties of the World.
